Definition at line 15 of file SystemArchitecture.h.

Member Function Documentation

int util::SystemArchitecture::CPUID ( int  Function,
char  reg 
)

CPUID(int, char) function that returns a int that contains the contents of the register specificed in the second arugment [reg].

2 input CPUID function.

Returns:
a int, which corrosponds to the register specificed in the second arugment [reg].
Parameters:
Function the CPUID function you want to execute, this is inputted with hexadecimal notation to make reading easier.
reg the register you want to return range ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D'] that corrospond to the x86 registers EAX, EBX, ECX and EDX.

Example use, the below function returns the total number of cores on a die

 CPUID(0x00000001, 'A'); //returns the contents of register 'A' [EAX], after running the cpuid function 0x00000001

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CPUID for more information on the CPUID instruction.

Definition at line 100 of file SystemArchitecture.cpp.

bool util::SystemArchitecture::CPUID ( int  Function,
int  bit,
char  reg 
)

CPUID(int, int, char) function that returns a single bit from a register specified after running the cpuid function specificed. 3 input CPUID function.

Returns:
a single bit, specified in the second arugment [bit] from the register specified in the third arugment [reg] after executing the cpuid function specificed by the first arugment [function].
Parameters:
Function the CPUID function you want to execute, this is inputted with hexadecimal notation to make reading easier.
bit the bit you want return, inputted in decimal notation range [0 - 31].
reg the register you want to return range ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D'] that corrospond to the x86 registers EAX, EBX, ECX and EDX.

Example use, the below function returns true if the CPU supports SSE and false if it doesn't support SSE.

 CPUID(0x0000001, 25, 'D'); //returns the 25th bit, from the register EDX after running the cpuid function 0x0000001

@url http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CPUID for more information on the CPUID instruction.

Returns true if the current cpu supports 64bit instructions

mboolean util::SystemArchitecture::MMX (  ) 

Returns true if the current cpu supports MMX instructions; otherwise returns false.

Definition at line 136 of file SystemArchitecture.cpp.

mboolean util::SystemArchitecture::multiProcessorCapable (  ) 

Returns true if the current cpu is multi processor capable, note that a true result from this does not indicate that there are multi processors in the system just that the cpu is capable of being used in a multi processor configuration.

Definition at line 164 of file SystemArchitecture.cpp.

mint util::SystemArchitecture::totalCores (  ) 

Returns the number cpu's on the die, note that a single package may contain multiple dies and this will return the results for only one of the dies.
